    StrTables.AbstractEntityTable — Type.

    Abstract type for Entity tables: Supports lookupname, matchchar, matches, longestmatches, completions

    StrTables.PackedTable — Type.

    Compact table Designed to save memory compared to a Vector{Vector{S}} Allows for fast lookup of ranges when input was sorted Can be saved/loaded to/from a file quickly

    StrTables.STRING1_CODE
    StrTables.STRING2_CODE
    StrTables.STRING4_CODE
    StrTables.STRTAB_CODE
    StrTables.StrTable — Type.

    Compact string table Designed to save memory compared to a Vector{String} Allows for fast lookup of ranges when input was sorted Can be saved/loaded to/from a file quickly

    StrTables.StrTables — Module.

    Simple String Table and load/save functions

    Author: Scott Paul Jones Copyright: 2017-2018 Gandalf Software, Inc (and any future contributors) License: MIT (see https://github.com/JuliaString/StrTables.jl/blob/master/LICENSE.md)

    Public API:

    Exported:

    • StrTable takes a Vector of some AbstractString type and returns a compact string table, that acts as a AbstractVector{String}

    Not exported:

    • matchfirst takes a sorted string table and a string, returns a vector of elements that start with the string
    • matchfirstrng takes a sorted string table and a string, returns the range of indexes of elements start with the string
    • save takes a filename and a collection (of simple types) and saves them to the file in a simple format
    • load takes a filename and returns a Vector of the values stored by save in the file

    StrTables.completions — Function.

    Given a string, return all of the entity names that start with that string, if any

    StrTables.create_vector

    StrTables.load — Function.

    Return a Vector{Any} with data tables loaded from IO

    Return a Vector{Any} with data tables loaded from file

    StrTables.longestmatches — Function.

    Given a string, return all of the longest matches to the beginning of the string as a vector

    StrTables.lookupname — Function.

    Given an entity name, return the string it represents, or an empty string if not found

    StrTables.matchchar — Function.

    Given a character, return all exact matches to the character as a vector

    StrTables.matches — Function.

    Given a string, return all exact matches to the string as a vector

    StrTables.matchfirst — Function.

    Return a vector of values that whose beginning matches the string

    StrTables.matchfirstrng — Function.

    Return the range of indices of values that whose beginning matches the string

    Read a single StrTable, String, UInt, or Vector of UInt value from the io device

    Save a collection of values (StrTable, String, Float, UInt, Int*) into an IO object
